snippet: A group closely allied with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo received $2 million from gambling interests last December as he developed a proposal to expand casino gambling in New York.
abstract: Public records indicate that Committee to Save New York, labor coalition closely allied with New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, received $2 million from gambling interests, including Genting and the New York Gaming Association, around the same time the governor announced he would push to legalize casinos in the state; Cuomo dismisses any suggestion of a link between the donation and his support for casino gambling.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE, DANNY HAKIM and CHARLES V. BAGLI

lead_paragraph: A group closely allied with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo received $2 million from gambling interests last December as he developed a proposal to expand casino gambling in New York.

headline.main: Gambling Group Gave $2 Million to a Cuomo Ally
headline.print_headline: Gambling Group Gave $2 Million To A Cuomo Ally
